intro: Phyteuma campanuloides var. sibthorpianum, commonly known as the Sibthorpian bellflower, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pale blue to violet, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged in a basal rosette. It prefers well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long bloom period and ability to attract pollinators.
